refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: void SSL_CONF_CTX_set_ssl_ctx(SSL_CONF_CTX *cctx, SSL_CTX *ctx); void SSL_CONF_CTX_set_ssl(SSL_CONF_CTX *cctx, SSL *ssl);

refsection.title: DESCRIPTION
refsection.para: SSL_CONF_CTX_set_ssl_ctx() sets the context associated with cctx to the SSL_CTX structure ctx. Any previous SSL or SSL_CTX associated with cctx is cleared. Subsequent calls to SSL_CONF_cmd() will be sent to ctx.

SSL_CONF_CTX_set_ssl() sets the context associated with cctx to the SSL structure ssl. Any previous SSL or SSL_CTX associated with cctx is cleared. Subsequent calls to SSL_CONF_cmd() will be sent to ssl.

refsection.title: NOTES
refsection.para: The context need not be set or it can be set to NULL in which case only syntax checking of commands is performed, where possible.

refsection.title: RETURN VALUES
refsection.para: SSL_CONF_CTX_set_ssl_ctx() and SSL_CTX_set_ssl() do not return a value.

refsection.title: HISTORY
refsection.para: These functions were first added to OpenSSL 1.0.2
